b.append("\t- 'list' to list the current list of tasks and their statuses\n");
b.append("\t- 'done' to set a task as done\n");
b.append("\t- 'todo' to list a untimed task\n");
b.append("\t- 'deadline' to list a timed deadline task, please structure with [deadline <task name> /by <time>]\n");
b.append("\t- 'event' to list a timed event task, please structure with [event <task name> /at <time>\n");
b.append("\t- 'help' to list these commands again\n");

* Exceptions.DukeException is a classification of errors that pertain to any running problems within Duke Class applications
* Some errors that may occur in the hierarchy of data flow:
* 1. FileRead Error (WIP): For handling stored memory and I/O errors
* 2. Bad Command Given: When a Command that is unknown is given
* 3. No Input given: When in the flow for a given command, no description is detected
* 4. Bad Date Given: (WIP): For handling date parsing errors
public abstract class DukeException extends Exception{
* Takes in the given bad input and the code
b.append("\t Oops you used a invalid command! Not sure what you mean by:\n");
b.append("\t Heres a tip, use the 'help' command to learn about my commands!\n");
* Takes in the given bad input and the code
b.append("\t Oops you requested for a index ourside the list range:\n");
b.append("\t Heres a tip, use the 'list' command to see the current tasks!\n");
* Exception Class to encapsulate any exceptional error that does not fit any of the previous criterion
FileRead(0, "A I/O and Filereading Error has occured."),
BadCommandGiven(1, "I cannot understand what that command means."),
NoInputGiven(2, "There was no Input given for the task."),
BadDateGiven(3 , "You did not give a valid date!"),
IndexError(5, "The index of the task is out of bounds"),
UnknownError(99, "Something Exceptionally unexpected has happened! We will shut the application down")
* Parse an error code into the Enum List for the given error message
